articles.author: Meghan Bartels
articles.title: The first solar eclipse of 2022 has begun and here's the view! - Space.com
articles.description: Live broadcasts bring the eclipse from South America worldwide.
articles.content:
It's the moment skywatchers have been waiting for: The year's first solar eclipse has begun.
The partial solar eclipse of April 30 began at about 2:45 p.m. EDT (1845 GMT), according to Timeanddate.c… [+2143 chars]

articles.author: CNN
articles.title: Don't look up: 2022's first solar eclipse will appear in the southern hemisphere today - ABC17NEWS - ABC17News.com
articles.description: By Zoe Sottile, CNN Today, people in some parts of southern South America, Antarctica, and the Pacific and Southern Oceans will be able to watch the first solar eclipse of the year. A solar eclipse occurs when the moon moves between the sun and the earth, blo…
articles.content:
By Zoe Sottile, CNN
Today, people in some parts of southern South America, Antarctica, and the Pacific and Southern Oceans will be able to watch the first solar eclipse of the year.
